Text: When asked what steps he would recommend to remedy tax foreclosures that result in government claiming 100 percent of the proceeds, Clifford responded: First, the states should be required to give any excess proceeds received back to the taxpayer.
Cause: When asked what steps he would recommend to remedy tax foreclosures
Effect: government claiming 100 percent of the proceeds, Clifford responded: First, the states should be required to give any excess proceeds received back to the taxpayer.
Sentence: <e1>When asked what steps he would recommend to remedy tax foreclosures</e1> that result in <e2>government claiming 100 percent of the proceeds, Clifford responded: First, the states should be required to give any excess proceeds received back to the taxpayer.</e2>
